verses.text: 當遠離淫婦我兒，要留心聽我的智慧，側耳聽我的哲理，

words.note: A woman engaged in illicit sexual activity.
An archaic term of address, meaning 'my son'.
Literally 'side ear'; meaning to turn one's ear to listen attentively.
Contextually referring to wise or sound principles/advice.

verses.text: 好讓你持守明辨的態度，你的嘴唇謹守知識。

words.note: Implies the ability to make good judgments.
Implies guarding with great care and prudence.

verses.text: 因為淫婦的嘴唇滴下蜂蜜，她的口比油更滑；
至終卻苦似苦菫，快如兩刃的劍。

words.note: Refers to the ultimate outcome or conclusion.
A plant known for its intense bitterness, often symbolizing sorrow in scripture.
Contextually means 'sharp' rather than 'fast'.

verses.text: 她的腳走下死地，她的腳步踏向陰間。

words.note: Literally 'dead ground', referring to the path or state of death.
Biblical term for the realm of the dead, similar to Sheol or Hades.

verses.text: 她不理會生命之路，她的路徑變遷無定，自己也不知道。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to modern '的'.

verses.text: 孩子們，現在要聽從我，不可離棄我口中的話。
你的道路要遠離她，不可走近她的家門；
免得你的精力給了別人，你的年日交給了殘忍的人；

words.note: A somewhat literary or biblical term for one's lifetime.

words.definition: to hand over, to entrust to

verses.text: 免得外人飽享你的財物，你勞碌得來的歸入別人的家。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to describe diligent, sometimes weary, work.

words.definition: to belong to, to go into

verses.text: 在你生命終結，你的肉體和身軀衰殘的時候，你就悲歎，

words.note: Refers to the physical body, often with a spiritual distinction in biblical context.
Describes physical deterioration.

verses.text: 說：「我為甚麼恨惡管教，我的心為甚麼輕視責備，

words.note: Often refers to divine discipline or parental guidance.

verses.text: 不聽從我老師的話，也不留心聽那些教導我的人。
在眾民的集會中，我幾乎落在萬劫不復之地。」

words.note: Refers to a large assembly of people, often in a religious or public context.
An idiom meaning 'cannot return from ten thousand calamities,' implying utter ruin.
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 要專愛妻子你要喝自己池中的水，飲自己井裡的活水。

words.note: Emphasizes devoted and singular love.
More formal or literary than '喝'.
Figuratively refers to spiritual life or sustenance.

verses.text: 你的泉源怎麼可以外溢？你的河水怎麼可以流在街上？
它們要獨歸你一人所有，不要讓外人與你共享。
要使你的泉源蒙福，要喜悅你年輕時所娶的妻子。

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb, similar to 'that which'.

verses.text: 她像可愛的母鹿，人所喜悅的母山羊，願她的乳房時常使你滿足，願她的愛情常常使你戀慕。

words.note: Reduplication of 常 (cháng) for emphasis.

verses.text: 我兒，為甚麼戀慕淫婦？為甚麼擁抱妓女的胸懷呢？

words.note: Can refer to a physical bosom or metaphorical embrace/heart.

verses.text: 因為人的道路都在耶和華眼前，他也審察人的一切路徑。

words.note: Refers to one's conduct or course of life.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Similar to 道路, refers to conduct.

verses.text: 惡人必被自己的罪孽捉住，他必被自己罪惡的繩索纏住。

words.note: Refers to those who practice evil.
Emphasizes the severity and consequences of sin.
Verb-complement, indicating a firm grasp.
Refers to moral transgression and wickedness.
Verb-complement, indicating firm entanglement.

verses.text: 他必因不受管教而死亡，又因自己過分愚妄而走進歧途。

words.note: Often refers to moral or spiritual instruction and correction.
Connects cause and effect.
Emphasizes both foolishness and presumption/recklessness.
Connects cause and effect.
Figuratively, to go astray morally or spiritually.
